html:
2.26.19  1:32 am   My friend told me that if we don't protect the earth, there's gonna be a whole in the ozone layer which will cause aliens to come on our planet.

So I told him that's nice. We could learn from aliens. Let them teach us stuff and grow more advanced as humans.

This could totally be a good and productive thing for us.

What do you think Bill?

     that's nice but if you don't close the ozone after the aliens get here then they're just going to leave

2.26.19  1:04 am   Do you find any of the joke questions actually funny?

     i take jokes very seriously

2.25.19  10:02 pm   Do you have any plans for the covers you said that you would do, or have you given up on the idea of doing covers at this point?

     i don't think i ever said which ones i would do, but i can't do the ones i wanted to do until i establish a relationship with the owners. and most songs on my list are owned by people who are difficult to form a relationship with

     perhaps the material sucks

     for all the other things to be real

Giving up is considered being worse then being bad but I'm considering giving up because I can't deal with the amount of failure I've received.

     giving up is only as bad as the amount you want the thing

     i have no idea

     it's fun when you get to make the chart

     call your friends and enemies

2.25.19  4:05 pm   what makes life so difficult?

     you, and me

2.25.19  3:08 pm   What's up with this pizza by the slice business 

     they can score big with people who are not willing to eat a whole pizza.

2.25.19  2:47 pm   Are you against capitalism?

     not necessary, capitalism is against itself

2.25.19  12:09 pm   I'm doing karaoke with my coworkers this weekend. I'm decently confident that I can do the actual singing, but like... I'm so used to having an instrument in my hands. Between lines/verses/etc. what do you do with yourself when you have no instrument??? Just stand there? Breakdance? Bop and sway gently?
I saw one of my favourite bands live in 2010 and the lead singer/guitarist sang one song with no guitar. Between lines, EVERY SINGLE TIME, he would take two steps back from the mic, look to the left, inhale, and swing his right arm back and forth to the beat in a comically wide arc without moving any of the rest of his body. It was painful to watch and I don't wanna replicate it. Do you have any suggestions about what I *should* do?

     you could trade some stocks

2.25.19  11:20 am   is there a chance that you would put any of your older music like "i can play" or "all u need is love" on spotify or itunes?

     yes

      thank you!

2.25.19  10:49 am   CAn you make full version of "That's the way i like to live my life" song from hi, i'm steve video ?

     the full version is a video with mixed musical/non musical content

2.25.19  9:21 am   i have short and rare bursts of creativity where i get tons of songwriting and recording done, but these don't last more than a few days at the most. i've been planning  out an album for months and i finally have every song written, but can never find the motivation for long enough to make the final recordings of these songs, because i think i've losing interestin the album itself. i want to stick with it because i know that the music is good and the concept will hopefully be well rev=cieved, but my mind has shifted to other types of music. i don't want to start something else because i'm afraid that if i just keep jumping to new things every time i lose interest i'll never get anything done. would you rather put out material that you're not entirely happy with or chase something perfect that may not necessarily be attainable? 

      ah, you must complete the 12 levels of suffering, then the 13th which is the unlucky last and final level; the reason it is unlucky is because after you finish it you will be informed that there is another level after that

2.25.19  6:18 am   I'm over 30 labor hours into animating this comedic bit. I'm finally reaching the punch line and I don't know how to draw it funny, because it doesn't even sound funny to me anymore. Tips for this feel?

     you might need to do projects at a funnier pace

2.25.19  6:10 am   Does logic make any sense?

     yes

2.25.19  5:49 am   i like to create things on this machine but the problem is that the machine can instantly give me dopamine from the internet at any moment. i usually choose this option instead of creating something. how do i avoid this and use the machine to create more things

     there are some services online which can lock you out of the internet

2.25.19  3:34 am   Around when in your career did the total duration every viewer spent viewing your work exceed the number of hours it took to create that same work?

     about May, 2015, when my vine channel started to become popular

      Do you consider that a valid threshold for success? 

     i never thought of it that way but yes

2.25.19  1:51 am   do you ever think of chords/voicings as a stack of intervals instead?

     sure

      Like, M3m3 would be a major chord expressed by a major third followed by a minor third. But in first inversion itd be m3P4, a minor third with a perfect fourth after it. Kind of what the idea is with roman numeral inversions, having I be root, I6 be first inversion (with implied third as middle voice, and the 6th being the top voice interval with bass note), and I64 for second inversion, (6th and 4th intervals from bass). Except this system ive been trying to figure out would show the relationship between each note to their closest note up and down. Ideally itd show all relationships, But I think intervals as a unit make sense trying to categorize chords not only by what notes are being played, but their inversions. Sometimes it feels like this way "harmony" or "notation" would make more sense. Best way I can think of it is a stack of geometry upwards like a totem, or stacked figures using the same center (with their corners touching the same imaginary circle).

Do you have a specific way you visualize/categorize relationships in music

     visualize it on the piano keyboard

      and how did you come upon it?

     the piano keyboard is wonderful because all the notes are laid out right in front of you in perfect order, but i am not the one who came up with it. for that we must thank John Piano

2.24.19  10:59 pm   how do i pay attention in school

     paying attention is effortless, if the material is any good. if the material is not good, pay attention to why it's not good. this will imbue some knowledge of what to avoid later when you make your own material one day

     solving some problems

2.24.19  5:13 pm   how to find best drum beat or pattern??

     besides a full on jackhammer, there is no drum beat that could ever be considered 'best.' to find what is appropriate, a good technique is to imagine writing a casual letter to a friend, and think about what drum beat that would have

2.24.19  4:09 pm   Does the downbeat mean 1 and 3, or does it just mean the top of the beat (like playing on the beat and not on the "ands" or subdivisions)?

     could mean either. you will notice those 2 situations will morph into each other with a quick change of the tempo dial

2.24.19  12:39 pm   How can i improve my jass on the piano w/o a teacher?

     if you have a goal to sound like something, all i can suggest is listen to it and then try to do it. it's probably the way you learned to speak any other language

2.23.19  11:33 pm   Found this comment on the genius video, thought it was a decent analogy:
"Listening to Bill's music and then asking him what the lyrics mean is like taking a bite of food and then asking the chef how it tastes."

     i think that's a quote from the questions page
